stimulusHtml: For 0≤t≤4 hours, Ruth's velocity can be modeled by the function g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbaaaa@39E8@ given by g ( t ) = 24 t + 5 sin ( 6 t ) t + 0.7 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@ . According to the model, what was Ruth's average velocity during the time interval 0≤t≤4 ?

features.html: Ruth rode her bicycle on a straight trail. She recorded her velocity v(t) , in miles per hour, for selected values of t over the interval 0≤t≤2.4 , as shown in the table above, For 0<t≤2.4,v(t)>0 .
